doc.previous: Algebraic combinatorics is an area of mathematics that employs methods of abstract algebra notably group theory and representation theory in various combinatorial contexts and conversely applies combinatorial techniques to problems in algebra Algebraic combinatorics is continuously expanding its scope in both topics and techniques and can be seen as the area of mathematics where the interaction of combinatorial and algebraic methods is particularly strong and significant
doc.after: Combinatorics on words deals with formal languages It arose independently within several branches of mathematics including number theory group theory and probability It has applications to enumerative combinatorics fractal analysis theoretical computer science automata theory and linguistics While many applications are new the classical Chomsky Sch tzenberger hierarchy of classes of formal grammars is perhaps the best known result in the field
